title: Windows JIT: Failed to materialize symbols
body:
The symbols are there though.
```
JIT session error: Failed to materialize symbols: { (Main, { __ymm@0000000000000003000000000000000200000000000000010000000000000003 }) }
[doctest] doctest version is "2.4.8"
[doctest] run with "--help" for options
===============================================================================
D:\a\lfortran\lfortran\lfortran-0.16.0-1112-g3e0fabf0c\src\lfortran\tests\test_llvm.cpp(288):
TEST CASE:  llvm array 2

D:\a\lfortran\lfortran\lfortran-0.16.0-1112-g3e0fabf0c\src\lfortran\tests\test_llvm.cpp(330): ERROR: CHECK( e.int64fn("f") == 6 ) THREW exception: "lookup() failed to find the symbol 'f', error: Failed to materialize symbols: { (Main, { sum3, f }) }"
```

It might have something to do with lazy evaluation, that the errors are not caught when the module is added, but later.
